metadata.Title: CVE-2023-38406 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
bgpd/bgp_flowspec.c in FRRouting (FRR) before 8.4.3 mishandles an nlri length of zero, aka a "flowspec overflow."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-38406` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 8.1-1ubuntu1.8
frr-pythontools - 8.1-1ubuntu1.8
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 8.1-1ubuntu1.8
frr-snmp - 8.1-1ubuntu1.8
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> the quagga project was renamed to frr

criterions.comment: frr package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1-1ubuntu1.8').
